description.narrative: Relevant stakeholders capacity improved to apply active labor market policies with focus on youth employment

activity-description.narrative: Relevant stakeholders are capacitated to apply active labor market policies with focus on youth employment.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

comment.narrative: 1.1. About 3000 of youth (1300 women and 1700 man) covered by jobs fairs organized by the local Centers for Employment Promotion and new initiative as WorldSkill, aimed at popularizing skills and competence development, encouraging standards of skills and competences. Technical assistance provided by UNDP within the framework of the project in establishing National Association for development and popularization of working professions and piloting 1st Open Skills Championship in Uzbekistan in accordance with international WorldSkills standards. 2.1. Training modules for young people to improve their universal/soft skills such as on writing a resume, job interview, foundations of labour legislation, employees’ and employers’ rights and duties, as well as on professional orientation will be developed and delivered in early January 2020. Tor for Nationals Consultants are developed and recruitment is in process. 2.2. The “Startup Initiatives” youth innovation ideas and startup projects support program has been inititated and being implemented within the framework of the project. As a result, 655 applications were received from all the regions of Uzbekistan and in total 150 projects were selected from Tashkent and regions to participate in the support program. 375 boys and girls and 26 local trainers are participated in the training seminars of the Programme in Tashkent and in 5 regions of the country with the provision of mentorship support for young projects founders. 250 million Soums were mobilized from partner organizations as prize money to award the best startup projects in January 2020. 3.2. ToR for hiring National Consultant have been developed and activities are underway to develop a methodology and guidelines for collecting data for measuring the unemployment rate among youth, disaggregated by gender in accordance with international standards. An international expert has developed number of recommendations on improving the administrative regulation procedures for the provision of public services in labor bodies, the interaction of ministries and departments involved in the formulation and implementation of policies to ensure employment, protecting the rights of workers and employers, education, and professional development.

1.1. The TOR and draft SOP have been prepared, yet the organization of job fairs was postponed to next reporting period with the view of quarantine measures taken during the COVID-19 pandemic. 1.2. The project engaged a National Consultant to formulate a Terms of Reference (TOR) to develop a mobile application for inter-agency hardware and software complex “Unified National Labour System”. The Request for Proposal (RFP) was announced on August 29, and due to the fact that submitted bids not met the requirements of selection criteria, re-announcement was made on October 20, 2020. The bidding was completed successfully and contract signed with selected bidder on Dec 25, 2020. The mobile application will be developed, tested and applied by users in next reporting period. 1.3. Over 500 video lessons are prepared on 12 core working professions and competencies with subtitles and sign language, which are taught in the “Ishga Marhamat” Mono-Center under the Ministry of Employment and Labour Relations of the Republic of Uzbekistan (MELR) aimed at transferring educational process into the distance and online mode to improve skills and qualifications of unemployed and people who have lost their jobs, to train and retrain them on working professions, develop their soft and modern skills (future skills), especially for women, and broadcasting them on TV-channels, social media and Internet. Bidding for procurement of server for storage of online video lessons has been initiated and potential LTA holder selected. Contract awarding, server delivery and installation expected in next reporting period.
The project has developed TOR on provision of technical and expert assistance for the establishment of the Centre for Qualification Assessment and the Center for Professional Education on Worldskills Standards in the Republic of Uzbekistan. Bidding conducted and contract signed with “WorldSkills Services” LLC (Union “Young Professionals – WorldSkills Russia”). Work on training and certification of 70 local experts and provision of technical support on independent assessment of 140 youth undergone professional training courses on 14 competencies will be implemented in next reporting period.
The project recruited a National Consultant to develop the Analytical Report with methodology on organizing Republican Competition under the Social Responsibility and Efficiency rating system. The report has been developed and workshop conducted for 15 representatives of MELR and other partners on competition procedures, data analysis and methodology on applying the rating system for assessment of competition participants. 2.1. Under the 4th cycle of the “Startup Initiatives” youth startup support programme overall 155 projects (of which 34 projects headed by girls) representing 1,610 youth (of which 355 young women) were trained and supported implementing their startup projects, and as a result of Demo-day where 28 best startups presented results of their projects. Out of them, [5] most prospective projects were provided seed grants by $5,000 each by mobilized resources from partner organizations.
The 5th cycle of youth “Startup initiatives” support programme launched online, attracting over 905 applications. Overall, 234 projects with over 750 youth (28% girls) are undergoing online trainings along with tracking and mentorship services by 6 experts on 13 topics. The project will allocate US$ 100,000 in addition to mobilized external funds in the amount of 1.0 bln UZS (by Youth Affairs Agency affiliated Public Fund “Yoshlar Kelajagimiz”) to support 40 startup projects (by $5,000 each) in next reporting period.
In addition, the project was engaged to implement “COVID-19 Rapid Response Framework” (COVID-19 RRF) project activities with overall budget of US$ 850,000. Within reporting period, the project achieved following results: 1) “COVID-19 CHALLENGE 2020” online challenge for innovative tools and solutions conducted attracting 600 applications, selecting and supporting [5] youth startups providing $47,500 seed grants aimed to help people affected by pandemic; 2) 32 small business and individual labor initiatives in 6 regions are supported by providing equipment and machines for total amount of $127,500 and provided business training to expand business, create employment and income opportunities for 150 women and youth; 3) In partnership with Chamber of Commerce and Industry (CCI) “Business Clinic” project is launched to provide business entities with instant consultations on support measures created by the government, providing over 2,800 hotline consultations, conducting over 60 short online webinars and posting over 350 infographics with excerpts from government support measures, Q&A and ‘Do you know’ headlines, and video answers to most critical questions; 4) In partnership with CCI Integrated Business Support project is launched, attracting 156 online applications from 5 target regions, 80 small business entities are selected and trained for 20 days on marketing, finance, business optimization and soft skills, selecting 43 projects and providing $10,000 worth of equipment ($430,000 in total) to expand their business opportunities and create new job places. 3.1. Methodology and guidelines for data collection for measuring youth unemployment by gender have been developed and submitted to national counterparts in MELR. 3.2. The project has engaged a National Consultant for conducting a study of international experience in providing public services in employment and piloting improved business processes in the provision of public services in the Center for Employment Promotion. Based on the study findings, 8 administrative regulations and visual schemes were developed on the provision of public services for organizations involved in employment support, skills training and advocacy for the unemployed. The regulations have been translated into Uzbek language. With the view of quarantine measures during the pandemic, the training events on active labour market policy have been cancelled. The project engaged an international expert, who prepared proposals for the implementation of the Foresight Skills Technology methodology, focused on forecasting the demand for professional skills, considering the future needs.
